main event: Two objects, one to two hundred feet in size, were observed moving in erratic paths over Greensboro, North Carolina in November 1957.
interesting points: The objects had the appearance of the Pegasus weather satellite.
The duration of the sighting was 30 minutes.
The objects were observed moving in erratic paths.
The conclusion was that the objects were probably a weather balloon or an aircraft.
The observer likely saw the Pegasus weather satellite.
